title: Bondi Tightens Trump Administration’s Grip on D.C. Police
summary: The attorney general cleared the way for the police to aid in immigration enforcement and named an “emergency” commissioner, setting the stage for a conflict with local authorities.

title: As Trump Seizes D.C.’s Police, Critics Say He’s Undercut Its Ability to Fight Crime
summary: The Trump administration has taken steps that have hobbled Washington’s efforts to reduce crime, such as gutting its U.S. attorney’s office and enacting budget cuts of more than $1 billion.

title: Russia and Ukraine Agree: A Trump Summit Is a Big Win for Putin
summary: The talks on Friday in Alaska pull the Russian leader out of diplomatic isolation from the West, and Ukrainian and European leaders fear it gives him an opening to sway the American president.

title: Why Does Trump Want to Meet With Putin, and What Are the Risks?
summary: President Trump wants to be seen as a peacemaker, but the meeting comes with enormous stakes.

title: Border Patrol Agents Show Up in Force at Newsom Rally
summary: The armed and masked agents assembled outside a museum where the governor was speaking in what Mayor Karen Bass of Los Angeles called “a provocative act.”

title: Newsom Kicks Off California Redistricting Campaign and Calls for Special Election
summary: The governor kicked off his campaign for a proposition asking California voters to approve a new congressional map, a move that comes with both opportunity and risk.

title: Man Fleeing an Immigration Raid Dies After Running Onto an L.A. Freeway
summary: The man was hit by a vehicle. It happened about a month after an immigrant fell from a greenhouse and later died following a raid in Ventura County.

title: Draft of ‘Make America Healthy Again’ Report Suggests RFK Jr. Won’t Push Pesticide Regulations
summary: The report is not final, but indicates good news for the food and agriculture industries.

title: For Some Patients, the ‘Inner Voice’ May Soon Be Audible
summary: In a recent study, scientists successfully decoded not only the words people tried to say but the words they merely imagined saying.

title: Treating Chronic Pain Is Hard. An Experimental Approach Shows Promise.
summary: A guitarist in a death metal band was one of several people who found that personalized deep brain stimulation eased their pain and helped them reduce pain medication.

title: Texas Democrats Will Return Home, Allowing Vote on Redistricting Plan
summary: The leader of Democrats in the Texas House said the battle over redistricting, which could determine control of Congress, is likely to continue in the courts.

title: The Auctioneer and the Treasury Chief: Billy Long’s Quick Fall at the I.R.S.
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent sought total control over the I.R.S., an agency where Mr. Long, the new commissioner, had started to put his own mark on the job.

title: PBS Slashes Budget by 21% After Federal Funding Cuts
summary: The nonprofit will receive less revenue from its members, which are under pressure to make up for shortfalls of their own.

title: Thousands Ask Harvard Not to ‘Give in’ and Pay Fine to Trump
summary: In a petition, alumni, faculty and members of the public asked Harvard to stand up to the White House. The school has signaled a willingness to pay $500 million to restore research funds.

title: Judge Halts White House Effort to Defund Schools With D.E.I. Programs
summary: The Trump administration had asked states to certify that their schools did not practice “illegal D.E.I.” and threatened to cut off billions of dollars from schools that did not comply.

title: Adams Pushes to Force Drug Users Off NYC Streets
summary: As he runs a long-shot third-party bid for re-election, Mayor Eric Adams is proposing an aggressive approach, favored by conservatives, of combating open drug use.

title: Eric Adams Vetoes Bill to Raise Wages for Instacart Workers
summary: The City Council is likely to override most of Mayor Eric Adams’s recent vetoes. Still, the mayor seems eager for a fight over bills affecting grocery delivery workers and street vendors.

title: With ‘Zohran’s Law,’ Cuomo Wants to Limit Who Can Live in Rent-Stabilized Homes. How Would That Work?
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal is a dig at Zohran Mamdani, his main opponent in the mayor’s race, but it could upend the housing search for middle-income New Yorkers.

title: Plan for Israeli Settlements Advances and Will ‘Bury’ Palestinian Statehood, Minister Vows
summary: Bezalel Smotrich, the finance minister, said on Thursday that a plan to significantly expand a settlement near occupied East Jerusalem had won approval. But a procedural step remained.

title: In Reversal, Toronto Film Festival Will Screen Documentary About Oct. 7 Attack
summary: Organizers said they had addressed concerns that led the festival to cancel screenings of the Israeli film, which includes footage of atrocities recorded by Hamas fighters.

title: Margaret Boden, Philosopher of Artificial Intelligence, Dies at 88
summary: A cognitive scientist, she used the language of computers to explore the nature of human thought and creativity, offering prescient insights about A.I.

title: ‘And Just Like That …’ Series Finale Recap: My Everything
summary: The “Sex and the City” revival ended on an empowering but bittersweet note for Carrie and the crew … and also with Barry White.

title: Were Carrie Bradshaw and Her Friends the Last Nice Rich People on TV?
summary: “And Just Like That …” showed New Yorkers awash in luxury. But Carrie and her friends lived with money, not necessarily for it — one of the reasons we’ve been drawn to them for decades.

title: Trump Is Not Likely to Hand Ukraine to Putin in Alaska
summary: Russia’s president has long insisted that Ukraine will be his. But his obsession may cost Russia more than he has bargained for.

title: A Cloud Forest in Ecuador Is Crying for Help
summary: Ecuador’s ecological progress is threatened by a series of reforms steamrolled by its young populist president, Daniel Noboa.

title: China’s Economy Slows Broadly Even as Exports Keep Rising
summary: Officials blamed U.S. “protectionism” for the dismal July data, but growth was likely held back by real estate and new policies aimed at slowing factory investments.

title: Jackie Bezos, Jeff Bezos’ Mother and an Early Amazon Investor, Dies at 78
summary: Ms. Bezos and her husband invested about $245,000 in Amazon when the online bookstore was in its first year.

title: What Hurricane Models Say About Tropical Storm Erin
summary: The storm’s likely path is coming into focus, but a lot can still change. Here’s what the forecasters look at.

title: A 500-Year-Old Receipt for Supplies to Conquer an Empire Is Returned to Mexico
summary: The document describes payments made for expedition supplies, and was signed by Hernán Cortés, who conquered the Aztecs.
